name: Key West
fun_fact: Fun fact: In 1982, Key West jokingly seceded from the United States and declared itself the 'Conch Republic' to protest a Border Patrol roadblock - they 'declared war' by hitting a Navy officer with a stale Cuban bread, then immediately surrendered and requested $1 billion in foreign aid!

hero_dishes.name: Key Lime Pie
hero_dishes.description: Tangy, creamy pie made with tiny Key limes, sweetened condensed milk, and graham cracker crust
hero_dishes.origin_story: Invented in the Florida Keys in the late 1800s, possibly by 'Aunt Sally' using condensed milk when fresh milk wasn't available. Key limes are smaller and more aromatic than regular limes
hero_dishes.where_to_find: Kermit's Key West Key Lime Shoppe, Blue Heaven, Key Lime Pie Company

hero_dishes.name: Conch Fritters
hero_dishes.description: Deep-fried dough balls studded with chopped conch meat, served with spicy dipping sauce
hero_dishes.origin_story: The quintessential Keys appetizer - conch (pronounced 'konk') is a sea snail that was once abundant in the waters. Locals are called 'Conchs'
hero_dishes.where_to_find: BO's Fish Wagon, Half Shell Raw Bar, Conch Republic Seafood Company

hero_dishes.name: Cuban Mix Sandwich
hero_dishes.description: Cuban bread with ham, roast pork, Swiss cheese, pickles, and mustard, pressed until crispy
hero_dishes.origin_story: Key West has deep Cuban ties due to the cigar industry - Cuban sandwich is essential here
hero_dishes.where_to_find: Sandy's CafÃ©, Cuban Coffee Queen, Five Brothers Grocery

hero_dishes.name: Pink Shrimp
hero_dishes.description: Sweet pink shrimp from the Florida Keys, often served in a shrimp boil or cocktail
hero_dishes.origin_story: Wild-caught from the Keys waters, these shrimp are prized for their sweetness
hero_dishes.where_to_find: Hogfish Bar & Grill (Stock Island), Half Shell Raw Bar, Eaton Street Seafood

signature_drinks.name: Cuban Coffee
signature_drinks.description: Super-strong espresso with sugar whipped into the first few drops, creating a sweet foam
signature_drinks.how_locals_drink_it: From Cuban Coffee Queen or Sandy's - order a colada to share or cortadito with milk

signature_drinks.name: Rum Runner
signature_drinks.description: Tropical cocktail with rum, blackberry liqueur, banana liqueur, and fruit juices
signature_drinks.how_locals_drink_it: At sunset on Duval Street or at the Holiday Isle (where it was invented)

food_culture_notes: Mallory Square sunset celebration brings food vendors nightly
Hemingway's influence pervades - his favorite spots still exist
Cuban, Bahamian, and Floridian cuisines blend together
Fresh seafood is caught same-day by local fishermen
